text:
Type I hypersensitivity to rubber.
 Seven patients with type I hypersensitivity reactions to rubber are reported.
 Radioallergosorbent testing with crude latex antigen was positive in 6/7 patients.
 Five patients had coexisting spina bifida, and all had undergone surgery before the development of rubber allergy.
 Rubber allergy is a new phenomenon that should be in the differential diagnosis of idiopathic anaphylaxis and urticaria.
